name: COUNCIL ON AMERICAN-ISLAMIC RELATIONS CALIFORNIA
mission: CAIR works to protect and defend the constitutional rights of American Muslims, thereby supporting the rights of all Americans.
theoryOfChange: By combining legal action, policy advocacy, and community empowerment, CAIR-CA seeks to dismantle systemic Islamophobia and protect the constitutional rights of Muslims.

score_details.score_summary: COUNCIL ON AMERICAN-ISLAMIC RELATIONS CALIFORNIA earns 61/100 due to good impact and good alignment.

all_citations.claim: The organization focuses on civil rights, policy advocacy, and capacity building for the American Muslim community.
CAIR-CA reported total revenue of $17,442,755, a program expense ratio of 83.7%, fundraising efficiency of $0.07 per $1 raised, and 14.5 months of working capital.
The organization accepts general charitable donations and Sadaqah to support its mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 61/100 score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and strong operational health, balanced against a moderate impact assessment. While financial management is a clear strength, more granular data on direct service outcomes would further validate its effectiveness.
areas_for_improvement: Limited external impact data regarding long-term cost-per-beneficiary metrics
Opportunity to increase transparency regarding specific program outcome data

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 30/50, the charity offers a medium fit for donors focused on civil rights and global education initiatives [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates moderate impact with a score of 31/50, primarily functioning through capacity building and legal advocacy [1]. Its financial health is a significant driver of this score, characterized by a program expense ratio of 83.7% and a substantial working capital reserve of 14.5 months, which ensures organizational stability [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California defends the constitutional rights of American Muslims through robust legal advocacy and civil rights protections.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 83.7% ensures most funds reach core services
Strong fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.07 per $1 raised
Robust liquidity with 14.5 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California (CAIR-CA) operates as a leading civil rights organization dedicated to protecting the liberties of American Muslims and promoting social justice [1]. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $17,442,755 to support its core programs in policy advocacy, media relations, and legal services [2].

all_citations.quote: Program Expense Ratio: 83.7% (Note: Financial data provided indicates 83.7%)
Your donation helps us defend civil rights

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 61/100 score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and strong operational health, balanced against a moderate impact assessment. While financial management is a clear strength, more granular data on direct service outcomes would further validate its effectiveness.

areas_for_improvement.context: While the organization tracks <cite id="4">5 outcome metrics via Candid</cite>, it currently lacks <cite id="1">specific beneficiary counts</cite> to enable cost-per-beneficiary analysis.
The organization's theory of change is currently <cite id="1">categorized as developing</cite>, and could benefit from a more explicit causal pathway document.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains strong governance with a 93% independent board and audited financials.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is currently tracking 5 outcome metrics and holds the highest transparency seal from Candid.
risk_factors: <cite id="1">No external evaluation of program outcomes</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="1">lack of third-party impact evaluations</cite> and detailed cost-per-beneficiary data.

confidence.notes: Financial data is highly consistent and recent.

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for donors interested in <cite id="4">civil rights and legal advocacy</cite> within the American Muslim context.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be improved by <cite id="1">expanding services to underserved regions</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust CAIR-CA due to its <cite id="4">Platinum Candid status</cite>, <cite id="1">strong board independence</cite>, and a track record of <cite id="1">operating for nearly 30 years</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization could <cite id="1">seek external evaluations</cite> to verify the long-term outcomes of its legal advocacy.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="1">83.7% program ratio</cite> and <cite id="1">14.5 months of capital reserves</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="1">tracking and reporting beneficiary counts</cite> to enable cost-effectiveness analysis.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Outcome tracking via Candid

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Funds local partners to support immigration and social services

rich_narrative.headline: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California defends the constitutional rights of American Muslims through robust legal advocacy and civil rights protections.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize civil rights protections and legal defense for American Muslims through a highly efficient, large-scale advocacy institution.
donor_motivations: Want to support legal protections for Muslim civil liberties
Value high financial efficiency and low overhead
Prefer supporting established organizations with significant assets
Interested in systemic change through advocacy and policy
giving_considerations: Focus is on domestic US policy and legal frameworks
High liquidity means the organization is financially stable for multi-year projects
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill zakat obligations or those looking for international humanitarian relief.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that the organization <cite id="4">tracks 5 outcome metrics</cite> but lacks rigorous external evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: CAIR-CA aims to protect civil liberties through <cite id="4">legal services, media relations, and public official engagement</cite>.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that legal advocacy effectively translates into protected rights for the community.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With <cite id="2">$17.4 million in revenue</cite> and rapid growth, the org can absorb more to expand geographic reach.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by an exceptionally high <cite id="1">83.7% program expense ratio</cite> compared to a <cite id="1">peer median of 78.4%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="1">83.7% of its expenses toward programs</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="1">peer program ratio median of 78.4%</cite>.
CAIR-CA maintains <cite id="1">14.5 months of working capital</cite>, providing a massive buffer for long-term legal and advocacy campaigns.
The charity demonstrates lean operations by spending only <cite id="1">$0.07 to raise every $1</cite> in contribution revenue.

strengths_deep_dive: CAIR-CA's financial health is characterized by rapid expansion and high transparency, evidenced by its <cite id="4">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>. The organization's ability to maintain a <cite id="1">83.7% program ratio</cite> while managing <cite id="2">$23,314,204 in total assets</cite> suggests a highly efficient administrative structure. Furthermore, its governance is supported by a <cite id="1">93% independent board</cite> consisting of 15 members, ensuring strong oversight of its <cite id="2">$17.4 million annual budget</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California (CAIR-CA) serves as a vital legal and advocacy shield for the American Muslim community, focusing on <cite id="1">protecting constitutional rights and civil liberties</cite>. Operating as a robust civil rights institution, the organization reported <cite id="2">$17,442,755 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year, reflecting a significant <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 49.7%</cite>. This rapid growth has allowed the organization to scale its <cite id="4">civil rights protection, legal services, and community education</cite> programs across major California hubs. Financial management remains a core strength, with the organization maintaining a <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 83.7%</cite>, ensuring that nearly all contributions directly support its mission-driven work. Beyond direct legal representation, CAIR-CA acts as a significant grantmaker, distributing <cite id="2">$4,148,077 in domestic grants</cite> to 39 recipients, including partners like the <cite id="2">International Rescue Committee SD</cite> and <cite id="2">Jewish Family Services</cite>. This collaborative approach strengthens the broader social safety net while specifically addressing the unique challenges faced by Muslim Californians in areas ranging from <cite id="4">immigration legal services to media advocacy</cite>.
